definition: to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
friend

sentences.english: We are committed to help them do the latter.
sentences.chinese: 我们承诺将帮助他们化敌为友。

sentences.english: A joke never gains an enemy but often losses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 玩笑不能化敌为友，却常是人失去朋友。

sentences.english: You will be quite friendly with your enemy when you both die.
sentences.chinese: 当你和仇敌相继死去，彼此即彻底化敌为友了。

sentences.english: You can not joke an enemy into a friend, but you may a friend into an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 开玩笑不可能化敌为友，却可能让朋友反目为仇。

sentences.english: Ajoke never gains an enemy but often loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 启玩啼总不能化敌为友，反而有时会失去敌人。

sentences.english: A joke never gains over an enemy, but often loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 戏谑不能化敌为友，倒常使人失去朋友。

sentences.english: To be reconciled is to be made friends again, or to settle any difference between two people.
sentences.chinese: 的意思，就是平息人与人之间的分歧，或化敌为友。

sentences.english: A joke never gains an enemy but loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 戏谑不能化敌为友，支能使人失去朋友。

sentences.english: Thou canst not joke an enemy into a friend, but thou mayest a fiend into an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 开玩笑不可能化敌为友，却可能让朋友反目成仇。

sentences.english: Joke never gains an enemy but often loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 戏谑总不能化敌为友，反而有时会失去朋友。

sentences.english: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
sentences.chinese: 爱是可以化敌为友的惟一力量。

sentences.english: A joke never gains an enemy but loses a friend .
sentences.chinese: 戏谑不能在化敌为友只能使人失去朋友。

sentences.english: A joke not gains an enemy but frequently loses a friend.
sentences.chinese: 开玩笑总不能化敌为友，反而有时会失去同学。

definition: to forget former enmity (idiom)
lit. to exchange weapons of war for gifts of jade and silk (idiom)/fig. to turn hostility into friendship
pinyin: hua4 gan1 ge1 wei2 yu4 bo2

definition: to become reconciled/to bury the hatchet
to forget previous differences/to bury the hatchet
It is better to squash enmity rather than keeping it alive (proverb)
pinyin: yuan1 jia1 yi2 jie3 bu4 yi2 jie2

definition: to start a feud/to become enemies
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
feud/bitter quarrel
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
enemy (idiom); opponent/arch-enemy
peaceful coexistence of nations, societies etc
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
an old grudge/old scores to settle
former hatred/bygone enmity
